solution_line_template: One year is {months_per_year} months, so during the first year, Kate spent ${entrance_fee_initial}/month * {months_per_year} months/year = $<<{entrance_fee_initial}*{months_per_year}={cost_first_year}>>{cost_first_year}/year on the tickets.
After that, she went to the museum for {total_years} years - {first_period_years} year = <<{total_years}-{first_period_years}={remaining_years}>>{remaining_years} more years.
During this time, she visited the museum {remaining_years} years * {visits_per_year_later} visits/year = <<{remaining_years}*{visits_per_year_later}={total_visits_later}>>{total_visits_later} visits.

She had to pay the higher price of ${entrance_fee_later}, so she spent ${entrance_fee_later}/visit * {total_visits_later} visits = $<<{entrance_fee_later}*{total_visits_later}={cost_later_years}>>{cost_later_years} in two last years.
In total Kate paid ${cost_later_years} + ${cost_first_year} = $<<{cost_later_years}+{cost_first_year}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} during 3 years.
